trans-unit.source: Add authentication on Apache Cordova with Mobile Apps | Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Add authentication on Apache Cordova with Mobile Apps | Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Apps in Azure App Service to authenticate users of your Apache Cordova app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Apps in Azure App Service to authenticate users of your Apache Cordova app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Apache Cordova app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Apache Cordova app

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the todolist quickstart project on Apache Cordova using a supported identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the todolist quickstart project on Apache Cordova using a supported identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This
trans-unit.target: This

trans-unit.source: tutorial is based on the [Get started with Mobile Apps] tutorial, which you must complete first.
trans-unit.target: tutorial is based on the [Get started with Mobile Apps] tutorial, which you must complete first.

trans-unit.source: Register your app for authentication and configure the App Service
trans-unit.target: Register your app for authentication and configure the App Service

trans-unit.source: Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Apps], then run your application
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Apps], then run your application

trans-unit.source: in the **Google Android Emulator** and verify that an Unexpected Connection Failure is shown after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: in the **Google Android Emulator** and verify that an Unexpected Connection Failure is shown after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happening becuase the app attempts to access the backend as an unauthenticated user.
trans-unit.target: This happening becuase the app attempts to access the backend as an unauthenticated user.

trans-unit.source: The backend redirects the user to an authentication
trans-unit.target: The backend redirects the user to an authentication

trans-unit.source: page using OAuth.
trans-unit.target: page using OAuth.

trans-unit.source: However, the application does not trust the OAuth endpoint.
trans-unit.target: However, the application does not trust the OAuth endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Open your project in **Visual Studio**, then open the `www/index.html` file for editing.
trans-unit.target: Open your project in **Visual Studio**, then open the `www/index.html` file for editing.

trans-unit.source: Locate the `Content-Security-Policy` meta tag in the head section.
trans-unit.target: Locate the `Content-Security-Policy` meta tag in the head section.

trans-unit.source: You will need to add the OAuth host to the list of allowed sources.
trans-unit.target: You will need to add the OAuth host to the list of allowed sources.

trans-unit.source: Provider
trans-unit.target: Provider

trans-unit.source: SDK Provider Name
trans-unit.target: SDK Provider Name

trans-unit.source: OAuth Host
trans-unit.target: OAuth Host

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: aad
trans-unit.target: aad

trans-unit.source: https://login.windows.net
trans-unit.target: https://login.windows.net

trans-unit.source: Facebook
trans-unit.target: Facebook

trans-unit.source: facebook
trans-unit.target: facebook

trans-unit.source: https://www.facebook.com
trans-unit.target: https://www.facebook.com

trans-unit.source: Google
trans-unit.target: Google

trans-unit.source: google
trans-unit.target: google

trans-unit.source: https://accounts.google.com
trans-unit.target: https://accounts.google.com

trans-unit.source: Microsoft
trans-unit.target: Microsoft

trans-unit.source: microsoftaccount
trans-unit.target: microsoftaccount

trans-unit.source: https://login.live.com
trans-unit.target: https://login.live.com

trans-unit.source: Twitter
trans-unit.target: Twitter

trans-unit.source: twitter
trans-unit.target: twitter

trans-unit.source: https://api.twitter.com
trans-unit.target: https://api.twitter.com

trans-unit.source: An example Content-Security-Policy (implemented for Azure Active Directory) is as follows:
trans-unit.target: An example Content-Security-Policy (implemented for Azure Active Directory) is as follows:

trans-unit.source: You should replace `https://login.windows.net` with the OAuth host from the table above.
trans-unit.target: You should replace `https://login.windows.net` with the OAuth host from the table above.

trans-unit.source: Consult the [Content-Security-Policy documentation] for more information about this meta tag.
trans-unit.target: Consult the [Content-Security-Policy documentation] for more information about this meta tag.

trans-unit.source: Note that some authentication providers do not require Content-Security-Policy changes when used on appropriate
trans-unit.target: Note that some authentication providers do not require Content-Security-Policy changes when used on appropriate

trans-unit.source: mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: For example, no Content-Security-Policy changes are required when using Google authentication
trans-unit.target: For example, no Content-Security-Policy changes are required when using Google authentication

trans-unit.source: on an Android device.
trans-unit.target: on an Android device.

trans-unit.source: Open the `www/js/index.js` file for editing, locate the `onDeviceReady()` method, and under the client creation code add the following:
trans-unit.target: Open the `www/js/index.js` file for editing, locate the `onDeviceReady()` method, and under the client creation code add the following:

trans-unit.source: Note that this code replace the existing code that creates the table reference and refreshes the UI.
trans-unit.target: Note that this code replace the existing code that creates the table reference and refreshes the UI.

trans-unit.source: The login() method starts authentication with the provider.
trans-unit.target: The login() method starts authentication with the provider.

trans-unit.source: The login() method is an async function that returns a JavaScript Promise.
trans-unit.target: The login() method is an async function that returns a JavaScript Promise.

trans-unit.source: The rest of the initialization is placed inside the promise response so that it is not executed until the login() method completes.
trans-unit.target: The rest of the initialization is placed inside the promise response so that it is not executed until the login() method completes.

trans-unit.source: In the code that you just added, replace `SDK_Provider_Name` with the name of your login provider.
trans-unit.target: In the code that you just added, replace `SDK_Provider_Name` with the name of your login provider.

trans-unit.source: For example, for Azure Active Directory, use `client.login('aad')`.
trans-unit.target: For example, for Azure Active Directory, use `client.login('aad')`.

trans-unit.source: Run your project.
trans-unit.target: Run your project.

trans-unit.source: When the project has finished initializing, your application will show the OAuth login page for the
trans-unit.target: When the project has finished initializing, your application will show the OAuth login page for the

trans-unit.source: chosen authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: chosen authentication provider.

trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: Learn more [About Authentication] with Azure App Service.

trans-unit.target: Continue the tutorial by adding [Push Notifications] to your Apache Cordova app.
